instruction: Pick a U.S. president and explain their legacy.
output: Abraham Lincoln is one of the most important and influential presidents in US history. His legacy includes abolishing slavery in the United States, preserving the Union during the Civil War, and vectoring the country toward modernization. Lincoln was noted for his leadership and political skill during a difficult and tumultuous period of US history. He was assassinated in 1865, but his legacy of courage and justice irrevocably shaped the course of the nation.
